meanings.definition: Capable of being educated or taught.
meanings.sent1: The young students in the class are educable and eager to learn.
meanings.sent2: She believed that all children are educable and deserve access to quality education.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy proved to be quite educable when it came to learning new tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, educable and ready to absorb new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The educable nature of the human brain is a remarkable feature of our species.

meanings.definition: Able to learn or be trained.
meanings.sent1: The rescue dog was educable and quickly picked up commands from its new owner.
meanings.sent2: As a teacher, she always looked for educable students who showed a willingness to learn.
meanings.sent3: The educable parrot surprised everyone by mimicking complex sounds effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His determination made him an educable athlete, always striving to improve his skills.
meanings.sent5: The educable nature of the human mind allows for continuous growth and development.
